title: Mama June sells her notoriously shabby Georgia home for just $100,000
text:
Advertisement

Her notoriously shabby Georgia home was given a slick, state-of-the-art makeover and subsequently put on the market for $225,000 by its new owners.

But Mama June Shannon reportedly accepted more than $50,000 less than its original valuation during the sale, with the property changing hands for a comparatively modest $100,000.

It's understood that June, 41, sold her five bedroom 3,225 square-foot home to real estate investors Felicia Harrell and Keller Williams Atlanta Partners in August after informing them that it could be sold for the six figure sum, TMZ reports.

Real estate: Mama June's famously messy Georgia home has been completely revamped and put on the market for $225,000 by its new owners (Pictured after)

Loss: But the TV personality reportedly accepted more than $50,000 less than its original valuation during the sale, with the property changing hands for a comparatively modest $100,000

The figure represents a financial loss for the TV personality, who is believed to have purchased the property in 2014 for $156,000.

A further appraisal, carried out in 2018, reportedly valued the address at $150,300.

Investors have since cleaned up the home, which was in a state of disarray while occupied by June and her boyfriend Geno Doak, before being listed for $225,000.

Pictures obtained by TMZ show the property in a clean, habitable condition after being littered with junk by the troubled reality star.

Previously: The property regularly had a skip outside the property, as well as hoards of clutter throughout (Pictured before sale)

Property: It still remains unclear whether she's still living there, or where she'll soon be living, after her and boyfriend Geno's arrest for a felony drug possession following a domestic altercation

It remains unclear if June is still living there, or where she'll soon be living, after her and Geno's arrest for a felony drug possession following a domestic altercation.

While June and Geno await trial for crack cocaine possession, their home, which is listed by Felicia Harrell and the Keller Williams Atlanta Partners, has been completely transformed.

A property which previously succumbed to dumpsters of rubbish piled up outside and broken windows boarded up now boasts a neatly manicured front lawn as well as shiny windows.

While trash was scattered throughout the abode before, the clutter has now been removed for the now sparkling floors to be seen properly.

Work was also completed on the property's garage door that was unfortunately broken after Geno crashed into it while under the influence.

Moving on: The five bedroom 3,225 square-foot home in Hampton, which was previously owned by June and Geno, now boasts a slick and glossy makeover for the new owners

Extreme Home Makeover: While June and Geno await trial for crack cocaine possession, their home, which is listed by Felicia Harrell and the Keller Williams Atlanta Partners, has been completely transformed (L- before, R- after)

Clean cut: A property which previously succumbed to dumpsters of rubbish piled up outside and broken windows boarded, now boasts a neatly manicured from and back (pictured) lawn

It seems like most of June's furniture and belongings are gone, as it was revealed last month that she had been selling most of her stuff on Facebook Marketplace.

With prices starting from as little as $5, June - who first soared to fame thanks to her daughter's Alana Thompson aka. Honey Boo Boo's turn on Toddlers and Tiara - was selling the likes of her Honda car manual, a bed and baby toys.

She had also listed a car stereo at $40, antique desks worth more than $200, as well as a Bob Marley stuffed banana for $10.

It has been tumultuous times for June, who was arrested in March for felony drug possession at a gas station following a domestic altercation with her boyfriend Geno.

Clutter: There were piles of trash scattered throughout the abode before

Spacious: The clutter has now been removed for the now sparkling floors to be seen properly

Oh no! Work was also completed on the property's garage door that was unfortunately broken after Geno crashed into it while under the influence

Airy: There is plenty of natural light coming in thanks to its spacious windows

It seems like most of June's furniture and belongings are gone, as it was revealed last month that she had been selling most of her stuff on Facebook Marketplace

It was reported by TMZ, that the reality star's sister Joanne is leading the family's intervention to get her away from her boyfriend.

In May, Joanne, along with WE TV, confronted her along with her younger daughter Alana aka 'Honey Boo Boo' with Dr. Ish Major but it didn't work.

Alana, 14, broke down and cried during the attempted intervention, adding that she wants to move back home. Alana lives with her sister Pumpkin for now.

On sale: With prices starting from as little as $5, June - who first soared to fame thanks to her daughter's Alana Thompson aka. Honey Boo Boo's turn on Toddlers and Tiara - was selling the likes of her Honda car manual, a bed and baby toys

Making money: She had also listed a car stereo at $40, antique desks worth more than $200, as well as a Bob Marley stuffed banana for $10

Tough times: It has been tumultuous times for June, who was arrested in March for felony drug possession at a gas station following a domestic altercation with her boyfriend Geno

Meanwhile, on Wednesday June and boyfriend Geno arrived to an Alabama courthouse to face felony drug possession charges.

They were pictured last week at the Tuskegee courthouse for their arraignment hearing, just a few weeks after a grand jury filed two charges again them following their arrest over crack cocaine possession.

She was arrested in March for felony possession of a controlled substance and drug possession charges.

Geno was also arrested for felony possession of a controlled substance, drug paraphernalia and domestic violence/harassment.

Getting help: It was reported by TMZ, that the reality star's sister Joanne is leading the family's intervention to get her away from her boyfriend

Intervention: In May, Joanne, along with WE TV, confronted her along with her younger daughter Alana aka 'Honey Boo Boo' with Dr. Ish Major but it didn't work

In trouble: June was arrested in March for felony possession of a controlled substance and drug possession charges
description: It's understood that June, 41, sold her five bedroom 3,225 square-foot home to real estate investors after informing them that it could be sold for a five figure sum, TMZ reports.
